skill.name: lint-fixer
skill.description: Use this skill to run npm run lint and fix linting issues. Triggers on fixing lint errors after code changes or validating code against project style guidelines.
skill.summary: Use this skill to run npm run lint and fix linting issues. Triggers on fixing lint errors after code...
skill.author: yamadashy

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill with no executable code. Contains only markdown documentation and JSON metadata files. No file access, network calls, command execution, or environment variable access. The skill provides linting workflow guidance without any system-level capabilities.

content.user_title: Fix lint issues with project lint workflow
content.value_statement: Lint failures slow down code reviews and block releases. This skill runs the project lint workflow and guides fixes while keeping code behavior unchanged.
actual_capabilities: Run the npm run lint workflow in projects
Apply Biome and oxlint auto fixes for style issues
Run TypeScript type checking with tsgo
Run secretlint for secret and credential detection
Guide manual fixes for remaining lint errors
limitations: Requires npm run lint to be configured in the project
Type errors from tsgo require manual fixes
Does not change code behavior to satisfy lint rules
Test execution depends on npm run test availability

use_cases.title: Pre merge lint cleanup
use_cases.description: Fix style and lint errors before opening a pull request.

use_cases.title: Team lint consistency
use_cases.description: Apply standard lint fixes after shared refactors across the codebase.

use_cases.title: Reduce CI lint failures
use_cases.description: Guide contributors to resolve lint errors that block the CI pipeline.

prompt_templates.title: Run lint and fix
prompt_templates.scenario: After code changes in a JS project
prompt_templates.prompt: Run npm run lint, list failures by tool, fix safe issues, and re run lint to confirm.

prompt_templates.title: Type error focus
prompt_templates.prompt: Run npm run lint, focus on tsgo errors, explain each fix, and keep behavior unchanged.

prompt_templates.title: Secretlint check
prompt_templates.prompt: Run npm run lint, review secretlint results, and remove any detected secrets safely.

prompt_templates.title: Strict lint pass
prompt_templates.prompt: Run npm run lint, apply Biome and oxlint auto fixes, then re run lint and summarize remaining issues.

output_examples.input: Please fix lint errors after my last commit
output: Ran npm run lint and grouped issues by tool
Applied Biome and oxlint auto fixes
Left two tsgo type errors for manual review
Re ran lint and confirmed style issues are resolved

best_practices: Review auto fixes before committing changes to ensure they match intent
Re run npm run lint after each fix round to track progress
Run npm run test after lint passes to verify no breakage
anti_patterns: Changing runtime behavior just to satisfy lint rules
Ignoring secretlint findings without reviewing them
Skipping the final lint rerun before committing

faq.question: What projects are supported?
faq.answer: Projects that define npm run lint with Biome, oxlint, tsgo, and secretlint in package scripts.

faq.question: What are the known limits?
faq.answer: Type errors from tsgo need manual fixes and are not auto resolved by the skill.

faq.question: How do I integrate this in CI?
faq.answer: Use it before or after a CI lint step to guide fixes and verify the lint pass.

faq.question: Does it access my private data?
faq.answer: No. It only runs project lint commands that already exist in your repository.

faq.question: What if lint still fails after using this?
faq.answer: Check remaining errors, fix them manually, and re run npm run lint until it passes.

faq.question: How is this different from a code formatter?
faq.answer: It runs multiple lint and type checking tools, not just formatting rules.
